news_header: Ahmed al-Sharaa has been named president of Syria's transitional government after the overthrow of Bashar al-Assad, with plans for a new constitution and elections.
news_text: Ahmed al-Sharaa has been appointed as the president for Syria's transitional period following the overthrow of Bashar al-Assad. He announced the cancellation of the 2012 constitution and the dissolution of the previous regime's institutions. Sharaa aims to establish an interim legislative council and integrate rebel groups into state institutions. He emphasized the need for civil peace and rebuilding state infrastructure. A national dialogue conference is planned, and it may take up to four years to hold new elections. Russia has expressed support for Syria's unity and recovery.
